museo-jud-o-de-sos-a.name: Ernst Kirchheimer
museo-jud-o-de-sos-a.bio: German-Jewish refugee who settled in Sosúa as part of the Dominican Republic Settlement Association (DORSA) in the 1940s, helping build the agricultural colony.

museo-jud-o-de-sos-a.name: Marion Kaplan
museo-jud-o-de-sos-a.bio: Historian who documented the story of Jewish refugees in Sosúa, contributing to the museum's historical narrative and academic scholarship.

museo-jud-o-de-sos-a.name: Rafael Trujillo
museo-jud-o-de-sos-a.bio: Dominican dictator who offered to accept up to 100,000 Jewish refugees at the 1938 Évian Conference, leading to the Sosúa settlement project.

chabad-vietnam.name: Rabbi Menachem Hartman
chabad-vietnam.bio: Chabad emissary who established and leads Chabad of Vietnam, providing Jewish services to travelers, expats and business visitors in Ho Chi Minh City.

chabad-vietnam.name: Mushkie Hartman
chabad-vietnam.bio: Co-directs Chabad Vietnam alongside her husband, organizing Shabbat dinners, holiday celebrations, and community programming.

chabad-vietnam.name: Rabbi Mendy Goldberg
chabad-vietnam.bio: Chabad representative who has helped serve the Jewish community in Vietnam, supporting travelers and residents with religious services.

jewish-community-vietnam.name: Rabbi Menachem Hartman
jewish-community-vietnam.bio: Serves as the primary rabbi for the Jewish community in Ho Chi Minh City through Chabad, providing religious services and community support.

jewish-community-vietnam.name: Jonathan Goldstein
jewish-community-vietnam.bio: Expat community organizer who helped coordinate Jewish life and social events for the small Jewish community in Ho Chi Minh City.

jewish-community-vietnam.name: Shimon Peres
jewish-community-vietnam.bio: Israel's former president who visited Vietnam in 2007, strengthening ties between Israel and the Vietnamese government and its small Jewish community.

igbo-jewish-community.name: Rabbi Howard Gorin
igbo-jewish-community.bio: American rabbi from Tikvat Israel Congregation in Maryland who traveled to Nigeria to support and validate the Igbo Jewish community's claims of Israelite descent.

igbo-jewish-community.name: Remy Ilona
igbo-jewish-community.bio: Nigerian author and advocate who has written extensively on the Igbo-Israel connection, arguing that the Igbo people descend from Israelite ancestors.

igbo-jewish-community.name: Rabbi Capers Funnye
igbo-jewish-community.bio: Chief rabbi of the International Israelite Board of Rabbis who has supported and engaged with the Igbo Jewish community in Nigeria.

jewish-community-of-nigeria.name: Remy Ilona
jewish-community-of-nigeria.bio: Leading voice of the Igbo Jewish community who has published multiple books documenting Igbo Israelite heritage and practices.

jewish-community-of-nigeria.name: Rabbi Howard Gorin
jewish-community-of-nigeria.bio: American rabbi who has made multiple trips to Nigeria to provide guidance and support to the emerging Igbo Jewish community.

jewish-community-of-nigeria.name: Shmuel Tivya Ba Ohanugo
jewish-community-of-nigeria.bio: One of the leaders of the Igbo Jewish community in Abuja, working to establish formal Jewish worship and education in Nigeria.

sephardi-hebrew-congregation-of-harare.name: Moira Sobel
sephardi-hebrew-congregation-of-harare.bio: Longtime leader of the Sephardi Hebrew Congregation in Harare, Zimbabwe, working to maintain Jewish communal life amid a shrinking population.

sephardi-hebrew-congregation-of-harare.name: Rick Abel
sephardi-hebrew-congregation-of-harare.bio: Served on the board of the Sephardi Hebrew Congregation, helping maintain the historic synagogue and community services.

sephardi-hebrew-congregation-of-harare.name: David Memory
sephardi-hebrew-congregation-of-harare.bio: Former president of the congregation who oversaw community affairs during a period of significant emigration from Zimbabwe.

zimbabwe-jewish-community.name: Paul Memory
zimbabwe-jewish-community.bio: Served as president of the Zimbabwe Jewish Board of Deputies, representing the community's interests nationally.

zimbabwe-jewish-community.name: John Laing
zimbabwe-jewish-community.bio: Longtime member of the Zimbabwe Jewish community who helped document the history of Jewish settlement in Rhodesia and Zimbabwe.

zimbabwe-jewish-community.name: David Memory
zimbabwe-jewish-community.bio: Active in preserving Jewish heritage sites and cemeteries in Zimbabwe as the community has declined through emigration.

communaut-juive-de-lubumbashi.name: Moïse Katumbi
communaut-juive-de-lubumbashi.bio: Congolese politician and former governor of Katanga province whose Sephardic Jewish father was part of the Lubumbashi Jewish community.

communaut-juive-de-lubumbashi.name: Shmuel Pinto
communaut-juive-de-lubumbashi.bio: Served as rabbi to the Jewish community of Lubumbashi during its peak in the mid-20th century when the copper mining industry attracted Jewish settlers.

communaut-juive-de-lubumbashi.name: Nissim Katumbi
communaut-juive-de-lubumbashi.bio: Sephardic Jewish merchant from Rhodes who settled in the Congo and helped establish the Jewish community in Lubumbashi.

lubumbashi-jewish-community.name: Moïse Katumbi
lubumbashi-jewish-community.bio: Congolese opposition leader and billionaire businessman whose Jewish Sephardic heritage links him to the historic Lubumbashi Jewish community.

lubumbashi-jewish-community.name: Isaac Memory
lubumbashi-jewish-community.bio: Elder member of the shrinking Lubumbashi Jewish community who has worked to maintain the synagogue and community records.

lubumbashi-jewish-community.name: David Memory
lubumbashi-jewish-community.bio: Advocate for preserving the legacy of the once-thriving Jewish community of Lubumbashi, which peaked at around 2,000 members.

windhoek-hebrew-congregation.name: Zvi Gorelick
windhoek-hebrew-congregation.bio: Served as rabbi to the Windhoek Hebrew Congregation, providing spiritual leadership to the small Jewish community of Namibia.

windhoek-hebrew-congregation.name: Harold Pupkewitz
windhoek-hebrew-congregation.bio: Lithuanian-born founder of the Pupkewitz Holdings business group and a pillar of the Windhoek Jewish community for decades.

windhoek-hebrew-congregation.name: Niko Pupkewitz
windhoek-hebrew-congregation.bio: Son of Harold Pupkewitz who continued the family business empire and remained active in the Windhoek Hebrew Congregation.

windhoek-jewish-community.name: Harold Pupkewitz
windhoek-jewish-community.bio: Founded one of Namibia's largest business groups and was the leading figure in the Jewish community for decades until his death in 2012.

windhoek-jewish-community.name: Niko Pupkewitz
windhoek-jewish-community.bio: Continued his father Harold's legacy in both business and Jewish communal affairs in Windhoek, Namibia.

windhoek-jewish-community.name: Tony Fund
windhoek-jewish-community.bio: Active member who helped coordinate Jewish communal activities and events for the small Windhoek Jewish community.

house-of-israel-community.name: Aaron Ahomtre Toakyirafa
house-of-israel-community.bio: Founded the House of Israel community in Sefwi Wiawso, Ghana, claiming Israelite descent and establishing Jewish worship practices.

house-of-israel-community.name: Rabbi Gershom Sizomu
house-of-israel-community.bio: Ugandan rabbi of the Abayudaya community who has supported and connected with the House of Israel community in Ghana.

house-of-israel-community.name: Alex Armah
house-of-israel-community.bio: Ghanaian leader of the House of Israel community who has worked to gain recognition and establish connections with global Jewish organizations.

house-of-israel-ghana.name: Aaron Ahomtre Toakyirafa
house-of-israel-ghana.bio: Spiritual leader who established the Sefwi Wiawso Jewish community in Ghana, guiding members in Jewish practice and identity.

house-of-israel-ghana.name: Alex Armah
house-of-israel-ghana.bio: Young leader in the House of Israel community in Ghana, working to connect Ghanaian Jews with Jewish communities worldwide.

house-of-israel-ghana.name: Yisrael Darko
house-of-israel-ghana.bio: Community organizer in the House of Israel who has facilitated visits from international Jewish leaders and educational programs.

yemeni-jewish-community-historic.name: Shalom Al-Yemeni
yemeni-jewish-community-historic.bio: Served as chief rabbi of the Yemeni Jewish community, maintaining religious life and scholarship in an ancient community with roots spanning over 2,000 years.

yemeni-jewish-community-historic.name: Yosef Al-Qara
yemeni-jewish-community-historic.bio: Prominent Yemenite Jewish scholar and leader whose family maintained the community's unique religious traditions and manuscript heritage.

yemeni-jewish-community-historic.name: Rabbi Yihya Saleh
yemeni-jewish-community-historic.bio: One of the most important Yemenite Jewish scholars, known for his commentary on the Talmud and codification of Yemenite Jewish law and customs.

yemenite-jewish-heritage.name: Rabbi Yihya Saleh
yemenite-jewish-heritage.bio: Major Yemenite rabbi and halakhic authority whose works remain central to Yemenite Jewish religious practice and identity.

yemenite-jewish-heritage.name: Shoshana Damari
yemenite-jewish-heritage.bio: Yemeni-born Israeli singer known as the 'Queen of Israeli Song,' who brought Yemenite Jewish musical traditions to global prominence.

yemenite-jewish-heritage.name: Rabbi Shalom Sharabi
yemenite-jewish-heritage.bio: Legendary Yemenite-born kabbalist known as the Rashash, whose mystical writings and prayer methods profoundly influenced Sephardic and Mizrahi Jewish worship.

libyan-jewish-community-historic.name: Esmeralda Meghnagi
libyan-jewish-community-historic.bio: Researcher and documentarian of Libyan Jewish history, preserving the memory of a community that numbered over 30,000 before its expulsion.

libyan-jewish-community-historic.name: Renzo De Felice
libyan-jewish-community-historic.bio: Italian historian who wrote the seminal study 'Jews in an Arab Land: Libya 1835-1970,' documenting the rise and fall of the Libyan Jewish community.

libyan-jewish-community-historic.name: David Gerbi
libyan-jewish-community-historic.bio: Libyan-born Israeli psychoanalyst who attempted to return to Libya in 2011 to reopen the Dar Bishi Synagogue in Tripoli.

libyan-jewish-heritage.name: David Gerbi
libyan-jewish-heritage.bio: Italian-Israeli psychoanalyst born in Tripoli who has campaigned to preserve Libyan Jewish heritage sites and synagogues.

libyan-jewish-heritage.name: Rabbi Nesim Trab
libyan-jewish-heritage.bio: One of the last chief rabbis of the Libyan Jewish community before the community's final expulsion following the 1967 Six-Day War.

libyan-jewish-heritage.name: Vivienne Roumani-Denn
libyan-jewish-heritage.bio: Libyan-born filmmaker who directed 'The Last Jews of Libya,' documenting the community's destruction and diaspora.
